##I am a PhD candidate at the International Institute of Information Technology, Bangalore, working at the intersection of disability studies, accessibility and assistive technology to analyze educational systems for children who are blind and visually impaired living in the Global South.  

Skills {#skills}
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- #### Qualitative Research:

- Interested in understanding complex systems using qualitative research methodology such as ethnography and action research.

- #### Quantitative Research

- Has undertaken projects for data analysis using R and Python. 

- #### Accessibility Testing

-Document accessibility testing for Word, PdF, Excel, Pub and PowerPoint files.  

- #### Document Creation Environments

-Can create documents using Markdown, Markdown, LaTex and Microsoft Office.

### Intern

Microsoft Research

Bangalore, India

January 2021 - July 2021

- Analysed and documented  the art-making practices of 10 visually impaired artists around the world.
    - Conducted studies to understand the semiotics of tactile art.

### Senior Educational Coordinator

Vision Empower

Bangalore, India

2019 - 2020

- Responsibilities included the creation of accessible STEM content, development of teacher training modules, creation of accessible teaching learning materials, teacher training, designing student engagements for visually impaired  students in middle school using story-telling, games and technology.
    - Involved in the VICT project which aimed to inculcate computational thinking~(CT) concepts in children with visual impairments through play. This included creation and validation of resources, weekly school visits for play sessions, observation and reporting, and creating the CT curriculum with the team. 
    - Worked extensively on secondary research in order to generate key learning indicators of numeracy skills for students in Grades 1-4.
    - Involved in a research study on the attitudes and perceptions of teachers on introducing digital literacy through games. 
    - Evaluated  technologies such as TAG and HEXIS created at Vision Empower and IIITB for students with visual impairment.
    - Conducted a research pilot for online story telling as a pedagogical approach for children with visual impairment.
